page.title: 16The Village Blacksmith
page.content: Stallingboroughs blacksmith told us that when he worked as an apprentice for 7 years he was paid 5 shillings per week but now pay is Â£10 an hour.He came to Stallingborough in 1952 and he's been here 33 years.When he came he mostly repaired farm machinery.He also used to shoe horses but he rarely does it now.In those days there was no electricity so every thing was done by hand which was hard work when you were smashing metal with a 14 pound sledge hammer.Even the forge was hand pumped. Nowadays he has machinery for cutting, beating,welding and lifting and with all these appliances he can make more things in less time with fewer people. The work he mostly does now is to make and repair heavy goods vehicles.He also does a lot of industrial work and just a little agricultural work.
